name: The ART OF THE NASTY - by Nigel Wingrove & Marc Morris
description:
A stunning visual record of a unique design legacy. The most comprehensive collection of video nasty and pre-certificate video sleeves ever reproduced in one volume.

FULLY REVISED AND UPDATED. This brand new FAB Press edition has more than 100 new video nasty sleeves, which were not included in the original pressing, to increase the total number of videos covered in the book to almost 450. In addition, the text has been thoroughly revised and updated to reflect the knowledge gained about this era in the intervening 10 years since the book was first published. And this time the book is in hardback format to ensure its long-lasting durability.

name: BLOODY HAMMER - S/T 12" LP
description: Who says crusts cant play Oi!. CRIMINAL DAMAGE did it and now BLOODY HAMMER are doing it. 10 track debut LP from this Melbourne outfit put out on hardcore victims.

name: BOOK OF THE DEAD The Complete History of Zombie Cinema - by Jamie Russell
description: Covering hundreds of movies from America, Europe and Asia, this exhaustive history chronicles the zombie's on-screen evolution from Caribbean bogeyman to flesh-eating corpse. Along the way, Book of the Dead takes in Bela Lugosi B-movies, Italian gore films, Asian zombies, British zombies, blind monk zombies, shot-on-video backyard epics and the videogame phenomenon of Resident Evil. Spanning seven decades of horror movie history with hundreds of stills - including an incredible 64 pages of blood-drenched full colour photos and rare international poster art - and an exhaustive filmography, Book of the Dead explains why we continue to be so fascinated with these fugitives from the undertaker.

name: BORN BAD - In The Dark 7" EP
description:
This older release from Winnipeg, Canada's Born Bad shows where it all began with four tracks of ugly and pissed off hardcore with gruff vocals.

.... This is from a different 7" but just to give you an idea

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/JEbrDK0PC1w" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: BRAIN F≠ - So Dim 7" EP
description:
This  is awesome, this band is awsome. Noisy garage punk. With vocal melody and harmonys to match L.A.'s X pulled out of a pit of distorted dirge, this record makes you want to do bad things! A-side really overshadows the b-side though; but it's cool, just spin the a-side - it's killer.

<iframe width="100%" height="166" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="http://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Ftracks%2F17924926&show_artwork=true"></iframe>

name: BRAIN F≠ - Sleep Rough 12" LP
description: This record is a little harder to get into than the 7", but once you do you are rewarded with a bounty of cool tracks to bop to... Brain F≠ - V2 by Static Shock Records

name: BRAIN KILLER - Demo 7"
description:
If you dont know BRAIN KILLER you've probably been living in a cave. This is a limited edition pressing of the BRAIN KILLER demo cassette on vinyl. split release with vinyl rites. 8 songs.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/mW3qk5fGiVw" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: BRAINKILLER - Every Actual State Is Corrupt 12" LP
description:
BRAINKILLER's first full-length release picks up right where their demo and 7" left off with blazing hardcore punk that combines early Japanese hardcore with more recent American bands like DEATHREAT and TALK IS POISON.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/-u3biTW9tnA" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: BRAIN SLUG - CREEP // annihilate me CS
BRAIN TUMORS - Fuck You Forever 7" E.P.
description: Brain Tumors is a four piece band from Minneapolis, Minnesota who formed in 2009. Brain Tumors play an ultra pissed, aggressive and no-frills style of hardcore/punk with a killer early 80's vibe to their sound."Fuck You Forever" is the band's 2012 latest six song EP, which was recently released via Deranged Records. Brain Tumors features crunching riffs, thunderous bass, rapid drumming, and venomously spat vocals.

name: CANNIBAL HOLOCAUST - by Harvey Fenton
description:
REVISED AND UPDATED COLLECTOR'S EDITION

This book is the fully authorised guide to the amazing films of Ruggero Deodato, whose notorious masterpiece CANNIBAL HOLOCAUST is analysed in depth along with all his other movies, which include HOUSE ON THE EDGE OF THE PARK, WAVES OF LUST, CUT AND RUN, LAST CANNIBAL WORLD, BODYCOUNT, PHANTOM OF DEATH,THE BARBARIANS, DIAL: HELP, THE ATLANTIS INTERCEPTORS and LIVE LIKE A COP, DIE LIKE A MAN.

Fully revised and updated, with an extra 16 pages of new text and illustrations, and issued in hardback for the first time.

name: CAREER SUICIDE - Cherry Beach 7" EP
description:
Summer banger! Don't know if CS can put a foot wrong really. Another great EP. Cherry Beach is a stand out, full summer party vibe! Comes with a poster drawn by Dave Neeson

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/Dx0ac4_3iYE" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: CINEMA SEWER Vol. 1 - by Robin Bougie
description:
The ultimate guide to the wildest excesses of grindhouse movies and beyond... Get Ready to Be Flushed!

The celebrated underground smash that is Cinema Sewer the magazine has been transformed and mutated into CINEMA SEWER: THE BOOK - and it’s here to educate, entertain and enrage you!

A mind-melting compilation of gonzo writing, illustration and comics about the most insane, sexy, awkward, cheesy, hilarious, upsetting and jaw-dropping movies in the history of film, Cinema Sewer joyously celebrates the sleaziest aspects of the moviegoing experience, whilst delving deep into bizarre cinematic history.

The best of the first twelve long-out-of-print issues of the magazine have been exhaustively revised and collected here, along with almost 100 pages of never-before-seen interviews, rants, comics, hard-to-find classic movie advertising, and graphic illustrations!

name: CINEMA SEWER Vol. 2 - by Robin Bougie
description:
The ultimate guide to the wildest excesses of grindhouse movies and beyond... Get Ready to Be Flushed!

The celebrated underground smash that is Cinema Sewer the magazine has been transformed and mutated into CINEMA SEWER: THE BOOK - and following the runaway success of the first volume, we're delighted to be unleashing VOLUME TWO onto a now slightly-less-unsuspecting world!

Issues 13 to 16 of this celebrated underground smash magazine are exhaustively revised and collated in this second wild volume, together with an additional 90 pages of never-before-seen interviews, rants, comics, hard-to-find classic movie advertising, and graphic illustrations by Bougie and a host of his talented friends from both the comic book and animation industry. Regardless of whether the reader is just discovering the world of classic porn, horror, and exploitation movies, or if they're a long time fan from the days when the drive-ins and grindhouses reigned, they'll find plenty to get excited about, gleefully sloshing around in the filth of the Cinema Sewer!

Click here for more information, and to order your copy, which is in stock and shipping now!

name: CINEMA SEWER Vol. 3 - by Robin Bougie
description:
The ultimate guide to the wildest excesses of grindhouse movies and beyond... Get Ready to Be Flushed!

Following the outstanding popularity of the first two books, CINEMA SEWER VOLUME THREE is about to be unleashed onto the world!

A mind-melting compilation of gonzo writing, illustration and comics about the most insane, sexy, awkward, cheesy, hilarious, upsetting and jaw-dropping movies in the history of film, Cinema Sewer joyously celebrates the sleaziest aspects of the bizarre cinematic history.

Regardless of whether you're just discovering the world of classic porn, horror, and exploitation movies, or if you're a long time fan, you'll find plenty to get excited about, as you gleefully slosh around in the filth of the Cinema Sewer!

name: CREEM - S/T 12" LP
description:
This release marks the first 12" release from premier NYHC act CREEM. The band jumps light years ahead of the recording session that spawned a demo cassette and 7" single and creates a piece of music that is far and away its best material. Six originals and a cover of Boston/UK-influenced hardcore.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/pePp04G4pb4" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: DARIO ARGENTO The Man, the Myths and the Magic - by Alan Jones
description: Internationally renowned writer, broadcaster and author Alan Jones has tirelessly reported on every aspect of Argento's career for more than three decades. Every single feature, interview, review and in-depth look at Argento's multi-faceted universe was meticulously collated into one stunning, Sold Out volume, originally called Profondo Argento. Available again at last, now under a new title and cover, Dario Argento: The Man, the Myths and the Magic includes a wealth of fresh material and interviews exclusively conducted for this exhaustive overview of Argento's extraordinary body of work. Illustrated with rare stills, posters and candid behind-the-scenes photos from the author's private collection, Jones probes deep into the psyche and methodology of one of the world's most celebrated genre directors - and in doing so also uncovers the luminous chaos of the entire Italian Film Industry itself.

name: DRIBBLE - Demo CS Tape
description:
Fucking sick slow demented hardcore from the gutters and scum of melbourne. If you you like your head to be fucked with laser guitar riffs and cosmic bubblegum beats then fuck off cos that sentence doesnt make sense. but this band is sick.

<iframe width="100%" height="166" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Ftracks%2F90097904"></iframe>

name: EAT A BRICK - Demo 7"
description:
EAT A BRICK were a bunch of surfer dudes from the southern coast of New South Wales, who went on to form SOMA COMA. In 2007, they were somehow pried off the couch and into the studio to record the most ripping demo of the year by combining the psycho fury of American bands of yore, like DEEP WOUND and H100S, with the sounds of Australian contemporaries like EXTORTION, STRAIGHTJACKET NATION, MASSTRAUMA and HARD LUCK. Comes in very limited edition of 50 on black vinyl with red covers and 50 on translucent green vinyl with white covers. All hand numbered.

<iframe src="http://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Ftracks%2F42585987&show_artwork=true" frameborder="no" scrolling="no" width="100%" height="166"></iframe>

name: FLESH & BLOOD Vol. 2 - by Harvey Fenton
description:
The Cult Movie Journal that Boldly Strode into the Dark Heart of the Exploitation Film Jungle!

The widely acclaimed journal of cinema and video for adults returns with this uncompromising collection of cutting-edge features and interviews.

name: FRONT LINE - Basic Training 7" EP
description:
Unreleased E.P. from 1982, Norfolk hardcore, Virginia. Dont know where this material was hiding. It sounds like one of those bands you hear on an old punk movie when they go to a club and there is some ruthless slamming going on. Well why not turn your life into a dope punk movie, BUY and SLAM!

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/1IRAGeRrSdk" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: GIRLS KISSING Vol. 1 - by Paul Mallinson
description:
Girls kissing girls... one of nature's most wondrous sights! Pretty simple. 

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/jg3jk8nMevQ" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: GRUEL - Spray Tan CS
description:
Gritty lo-fi recording. A woman and a man are chased and tortured by a gang of youths.

<iframe width="100%" height="166" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Ftracks%2F108884103"></iframe>

name: HARD SKIN - We're the fucking george CS
description:
English Oi! lots of beer, fighting and bonehead sing alongs. not heaps keen on this type of Oi! seems silly to me. Like they are from a skinhead soapy in the vein of that shit 'this is england' crap. No loner fucked in the head vibe.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/ELJkB_65bjc" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: THE HELPLESS - Absurd Human Performance 7" EP
description:
Real hectic noise shit. Thick bass with shredding guitar definitely some japanese influence here. If you like your punk fast, mean and messy then this will be a gem for you.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/mG7r6_hg9U4" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: HOUSE OF PSYCHOTIC WOMEN - by Kier-la Janisse
description: House of Psychotic Women is an autobiographical exploration of female neurosis in horror and exploitation films. Anecdotes and memories interweave with film history, criticism, trivia and confrontational imagery to create a reflective personal history and examination of female madness, both onscreen and off.

name: IMPALERS - Demo '10 7" EP
description: After its initial release as a demo tape in late 2010, we bring you the first recordings from Austin’s own IMPALERS on 7”. Five blown out tracks of D-Beat tinged metalbanger punk that gives nods to the greats like MOTORHEAD, CELTIC FROST, DISCHARGE and ANTI CIMEX among others; brought to us by the riff master of MAMMOTH GRINDER and the beast beat keeper of HATRED SURGE.................. (Beach Impediment/No Way.)

name: KRÖMOSOM - S/T 12" LP
description:
This record is totally pitiless, riff-heavy Scandinavian style punx for fans of ANTI-CIMEX and PISSCHRIST (also featuring ex-members of). 

<iframe width="370" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/zQYNYQ4TPt8" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: KRUEL/UNLEARN - Split 7" EP
description:
KRUEL are a raw DBeat assault killing it in the Los Angeles Raw Ponx scene. No frills and no filler, just kick ass ANTICIMEX, SHITLICKERS worshipping hardcore punk. Unlearn are a raw and brutal Dbeat attack from Vancouver. 5 minutes of pure distortion and maximum volume with guitar torture worthy of comparisons to the greats. A loud and noisy fury of raw punk levelling everything in their path. Vocals distorted in anguish and a wall of guitars tweaked to ear splitting frequencies held down with an impressive d-beat attack. If you're a fan of Disclose, Anti-Cimex, or raw punk in general, you should definitely check this out! 

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/xd9037tFqVM" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: LEPROSY - S/T 7" EP
description:
Violent sounding punk. Definitely gets you amped to protest or graff some cop cars. UK82 revisited, for fans of being on the dole, drinking tallys, having many dogs and living in squats. 

<iframe width="370" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/cMH9Ai8SSxs" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: LINDA BLAIR'S ABORTION - Won't Stay Dead 7" EP
description: It's good to find bands with no values, mainly because these are the same values I have and it makes me feel that maybe all my homicidal thoughts aren't all that strange after all. Fast raw punk stuff, NO VALUES! NO CHEAP FRILLS!

name: NEGATIVE LIFESTYLE - Panic 7" EP
description:
2nd 7” from Sweden’s NEGATIVE LIFESTYLE offers more of the same sloppy 80’s hardcore punk by way of Europe. On Panic, the band returns with 7 new tracks that include a few melodic gems that really sets this record apart. No bullshit, no reverb, no trend-hop – just a three piece trying to play pop songs using 80’s hardcore as its medium.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/qigGIpuDDgo" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: NEGATIVE REINFORCEMENT - Enemies in High Places 7" EP
description: <iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/4_1hyoBZS60" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: NEGATIVE REINFORCEMENT - Dog 12" LP
description:
Recent release from perth hardcore band

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/HDMM28Gh3xo" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: NIGHT BIRDS - Fresh Kills Vol. 1 12" LP
description:
With the NIGHT BIRDS first three 7" singles all now out of print, we decided that the easiest solution to keep these tunes available on vinyl for the masses would be to press up the "Fresh Kills Vol. 1" collection onto 12" format! This LP compiles the first two years of the band's existence; including their 2009 demo, their highly sought after "Killer Waves" 7" on Art of the Underground, the "Self-Titled" EP on Dirtnap / Grave Mistake, and their "Midnight Movies" 7" on No Way Records; 15 tracks in all. We've also added concise liner notes from the band discussing each release collected on this LP. These Jersey boys take all of the best elements from bands like ADOLESCENTS, D.I., AGENT ORANGE, and DEAD KENNEDYS (to name a few), to create some of the most infectious snotty surf-influenced hardcore punk this side of Rikk Agnew's cat corpse.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/EoTa1wQunHg" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: NIGHT STALKERS - Demo '11 7"
description:
This band fucking kills it. Hailing from france, taking ques from cleveland HC and KBD this record rails and damages brain cells. 

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/zZlpayJHS7k" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: NO - S/T 12" EP
description:
Unrelenting barrage! Some pissed off cunts from England give us 8 tracks of hate. Heaps distorted, fast, crazed, lunacy and one slow stomper. If you like MENS INTEREST, COLD SWEAT you'll love this band.

<iframe width="100%" height="166" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="http://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Ftracks%2F36697374&show_artwork=true"></iframe>

name: NS MAYHEM - Demo CS
description:
Noble Savages Mayhem! Killer Australian hardcore with many nods to US and Canadian HC. In the vein of URBAN BLIGHT, NEGATIVE FX. Listen to the last track for a hidden message. Go fuck yourselves.

<iframe width="100%" height="450" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="http://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fusers%2F9806427&show_artwork=true"></iframe>

name: OBLITERATION - This Is Tomorrow 7" EP
description:
New five song platter picking up where the first EP left off, keeping things on track with the early US meets early Scandi HC sound, but adding a dash of MOTORHEAD for good measure.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/wjG_IsaBhG4" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: OILY BOYS - Demo CS
description: <iframe width="100%" height="166" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="http://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Ftracks%2F68130161&show_artwork=true"></iframe>

name: OMEGAS - New York Terminator 7" EP
description:
OMEGAS latest 5-song EP helps to make the longstanding case, that at any given time, there will always be a couple good French Canadian bands (VOIVOD, CAPITALIST ALIENATION, etc.). This band is the New York <--> Montreal connection (look it up) performing the kind of tunefully skanktastic cuts made famous by basically any band on the NY Thrash comp in 1982. Painkiller brings you another slab of OMEGA-ish braincell smashing destruction.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/xGxUwjaL8Jw" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: OUR WAR - If You're Not Now... 10" LP
description: Featuring members of Chokehold, Swarm, Chokehold, and Haymaker. Aggresive straight-edge hardcore.

name: PAINS zine #5
description: Decent zine outta Toronto. Interviews with URBAN BLIGHT, SCHOOL JERKS, CAREER SUICIDE, BAD CHOICE, MAD MEN, FUCKED UP, MOLESTED YOUTH.

name: PLASTIC BAGS - Demo CS
RATBAG - Freeballin' LP 12"
description:
First release from Sydney sewer creatures, Ratbag. High-impact, lowbrow hardcore for fans of AVO, Poison Idea, DRI and Rodney Rude. Thrash-tinged riffs, backed by vocals that sound like a blue in a Red Rooster parking lot. Zero care. Zero hardcore fantasy. 100% filthy Australian reality

Limited to 300 (100 on green splatter) + A3 poster


<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/061pWIwdBYo" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: RAW PRAWN - S/T 7" EP
description:
Sydney’s Raw Prawn have been spreading themselves around for a little bit now, forming in early 2011. Made up of members from bands as disparate as Holy Balm and Whores - Raw Prawns unique blend of weird rock and endearingly quipped ‘yobo punk’ recalls The Urinals, strains of Australian ‘murder punk’ such as Razar and The Victims, and even the refracted post-punk of UK band Swell Maps.

<iframe width="100%" height="166" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Ftracks%2F71620343"></iframe>

name: REGULATIONS - Different Needs 7" EP
description:
This is classic juvenile snotty punk. Four tracks of pogo inspiring punk rock from Sweden.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/XHljuYpaQM8" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: RICK TREMBLES' MOTION PICTURE PURGATORY Vol. 1 - Rick Trembles
description:
An incomparable collection of comic-strip concoctions configured to critique film!

"Genius... a joy to read."
- The Guardian

"Trembles is a gleefully controversy-baiting critic. A truly hilarious, must-read innovation!"
- Empire

"Rick Trembles is among the few real innovators of comix and movie critics! Move over, Chas and Joe Bob; Howl, Gorehounds; Wake Up, Cine-Whores; Tremble, Hollywood hucksters! Rick Trembles is entering the braincells via the optic nerve - and you'll never be (or see) the same again!"
- Stephen R. Bissette (legendary comic book artist and creator of Swamp Thing!)

After over 20 years of drawing alternative comix, Rick has applied his boundless imagination and artistic talents to produce unique comic-strip reviews of an amazing cross-section of cult, horror, science fiction, arthouse and action movies from all eras.

name: RICK TREMBLES' MOTION PICTURE PURGATORY Vol. 2 - Rick Trembles
description: The second stunning anthology of internationally-published cartoonist Rick Trembles best work. Legendary underground cartoonist Robert Crumb has called Rick Trembles' comix 'even more twisted and weird than me' and renowned alternative cartoonist Chester Brown cited him as an early influence with 'immediate impact.'

name: ROYAL HEADACHE - S/T 12" LP
description:
2nd pressing of the grooving garage punk hits by ROYAL HEADACHE. Oldschool rock'n'roll musical flavour with a soulful disheartened sometimes menacing vocal attack. 

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/jOHOnb8Tv30" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: SCHOOL JERKS - Nothing Else 7" EP
description:
For those who don't know two former Teminal State dudes teamed up mith Matt from Spin The Bottle records and some other douche bag to record 3 short, fast and mean snotty harcorepunk songs. Killer!

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/Pu-EGq7_hx8" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: SECTARIAN VIOLENCE - S/T 7'' EP
description:
A nice breath of fresh air for hardcore punk in the harshest demeanor possible! This is the pummeling debut EP from SECTARIAN VIOLENCE, an intercontinental straight edge hardcore punk band comprised of members of bands from the US (COKE BUST), the UK (NEVER AGAIN), and Sweden (STAY HUNGRY). Fast, raw, pissed off hardcore drawing influences from 80's hardcore like THE ABUSED, LIFES BLOOD, NEGATIVE APPROACH, or early AGNOSTIC FRONT, with a contemporary take on the genre similar to more recent bands like VIOLENT MINDS or DEAD STOP. Raging fast parts combined with hard hitting breakdowns, all of which are executed with desperation and urgency of those classic 80's bands. Lyrically the topics cover a range of social and political issues, both globally and locally, seething with the frustration and anger that makes hardcore and punk still relevant in 2012.

<iframe width="100%" height="166" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="http://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Ftracks%2F21999245&show_artwork=true"></iframe>

name: SEX BEFORE SUICIDE #3
description: Latest issue of this outstanding French zine, and as with the previous issues it's absolutely exploding with content. This one takes kind of a wider view of trash culture, concentrating not just on punk music (though there are a heap of interesting record review), but also containing interviews with "adult content creators," performance artists, and others. This strikes me as maybe a little more for the sleazy TermBo crowd than your typical HC kid, but there's some interesting stuff nonetheless, and as always theres' a ton to read and it's all quite well-written and interesting.

name: SHACKLES / WORN OUT - Split CS
description:
Two awesome, heavy fucking bands. WORN OUT are full on power violence on the brink of bleeding into grind, fucking killer, so full on. SHACKLES side is real fucking heavy, like metal heavy. but its pretty sick like NAPALM mixed with PANTERA. Tape looks dope too, mustard yellow!, with insert. 

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/0S7sG_o5NM0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: SICK PEOPLE - Fakes Rule 7" Promo Tape CS
description: Violent Brissy hardcore from young cunts with no souls!!!!

name: SICKOIDS - S/T 12"
description:
Stretching the limits of punk. Many different thoughts pursued on this record but comes together nicely. Flowing from manic punk through tough hardcore to places never been before. These guys manage to grab sounds from the likes of POISON IDEA, ADOLESCENTS, EFFIGIES and yet nothing is bittin'. Can't go wrong with this, I dont care who you are.  ... philly punks

<iframe width="100%" height="166" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="http://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Ftracks%2F12811329&show_artwork=true"></iframe>

name: SKRAPYARD - Not Dead Yet CS
description:
Nasty Oi! hardcore from chicago. I like it. You make your own choice.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/AkkGTzoG_kA" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: SOMA COMA - S/T CS
description:
Erratic sleazy punk. Sounds bit like DIE KREUZEN orfor a modern day reference maybe CRAZY SPIRIT or GRABBIES. First release for these dudes and its been a long time coming. Tape sounds great though, good job on the recording. Only 100 of these.  

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/TlKOIGWMzg0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: STARVATION/NEGATIVE REINFORCEMENT - Split 7"
description:
Split label release between Life.Lair.Regret and Lethal Dose Records. Two of Australia's finest current hardcore bands. Dark, fast and filthy crust infused hardcore. Great artwork. Comes with download code. 

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/I2-deE2R4O8" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: STRAIGHTJACKET NATION - Live on PBS 12"
description:
Good collection of tracks here. Played live for PBS radio. Awesome fucking cover of "DAGGERS" by MASSTRAUMA 

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/JZbf0WUbTEk" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: TOTAL TRASH - S/T 7" EP
description: Young blood from Toronto doing straight forward hardcore. No frills or gimmicks, just well executed angst driven hardcore punk.

name: UNLEARN - Self Titled 7" EP
description:
Raging Vancouver d-beat lords spewing noise reminiscent of Disclose et al. Pumping.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/zwjRx4PEljY" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: UNLEARN - Self Titled 12" LP
description:
Posthumous album by Vancouver’s noisy raw punks. Follow-up If you’ve witnessed this bands live set you already know what to expect. A loud and noisy fury of raw punk leveling everything in their path. Vocals distorted in anguish and a wall of guitars tweaked to ear splitting frequencies held down with an impressive d-beat attack. These guys are definitely into DISCLOSE and MEANWHILE.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/zwjRx4PEljY" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: VACANT STATE - Fill The Void 12" LP
description:
Heavily oi influenced hardcore.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/OjOxLDHb_pA" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: VACANT STATE - Internal Conflict 7" EP
description: Four early-Boston influenced ragers on one side and a crushing dirge track on the other to help you contemplate the havoc you just wrought upon your room while listening to the A-side.

name: VACCINE - Dead Inside 7" EP
description:
self explanatory power violence on that straight edge tip. I feel like this band has a little more evil anger than the usual pv, like they are very anti-social or something. Its a fucking good 7.... 10 tracks. comes with insert.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/IYYr4cfwLy4" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: VAGINORS - Nuclear Papsmear 12" LP
description:
Noisy and abominable punk from some zany dudes in Adelaide. Sounds like SWANKYS!

<iframe width="370" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/PYwKNxu_N70" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: VELVET WHIP - tape CS
description:
I couldnt be fucked to do a write up for this so I just stole Dans description which i think he just stole off Tom ................  Six (6) tracks from the outside looking into the inside looking out. Self doubt, intelligence, paranoia, urban problems, claustrophobia, ugliness, animosity, and power. Velvet Whip execute with excellence. A real 2013 for 3013 time-capsule recording. A culmination of 30+ years of extreme and extremely amplified music channelling itself against that futile, foolish feeling that our life and experiences are constantly filtered through electronic signals, 0's and 1's. The sound of a computer chip being smoked through a bong. Die kruezin' or drop dead is the ultimatum here. For best results: Kill the lights, turn her up loud as she goes and repeat as necessary (if you dare?) Save your souls with rock and roll. Proud as sin to have our name attached this piece of plastic. ............. 


<iframe width="100%" height="166" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Ftracks%2F101244876"></iframe>

name: VIOLENT REACTION - S/T 7"
description:
Put your boots on its stomping time. I can imagine these dudes hanging around council flats hassling old people and fighting chavs. Antisocial hardcore with a big Oi! influence. Think they made 4 different coloured covers, for the pretentious assholes out there, we have green and blue available. 

<iframe width="100%" height="166" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="http://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Ftracks%2F56553660&show_artwork=true"></iframe>

name: WAR TRAUMA - Demo CS
description:
Dont know much about this band except they're from Brisbane and they play some solid power violence.

<iframe width="100%" height="166" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Ftracks%2F58642874"></iframe>

name: WASTE MANAGEMENT - Power abuse 7" EP
description:
Originally released as a demo tape in 2010, these 6 songs were frankly too good to not be re-released on vinyl, and play as perfect complement to their Get Your Mind Right 7". Six primitive HC offerings in the Ball of Destruction/No Policy style. Exceptional cover art by drummer Ken Fontaine..... they have a solid straight edge following cause they have straight edge songs.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/XRTWmCf75z4" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: WASTED TIME - Futility 12" LP
description:
Wasted Time continue to deliver their trademark hard-as-nails brand of US hardcore. With the expansion of the band to a five piece, "Futility" also finds the band drawing from additional influences, resulting in a more massive and ferocious sound than their previous releases.

<iframe width="368" height="278" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/JeLAlxQ-fCU" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: WHORES - Mob Reality 7" EP
description:
Seems pretty commonplace these days for bands to poorly record (and not good poorly either, i.e. a crude yet powerful demo tape) the first three songs they write, chuck them up on the inter web for cheap cyber kudos. Whores have taken a long time (also the label took a while too) to get their music out there. Instead of taking the path of cheap notoriety they’ve played show after show after show to the point where in their home town of Sydney they sit comfortably beside thick skulled hardcore bands, leather clad goffs, outer limit basement explorers and the true rock ‘n’ rollers.

<iframe width="100%" height="166" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Ftracks%2F48896895"></iframe>

name: WITCHCRAFT THROUGH THE AGES - Jack Stevenson
description:
The fascinating story of the world’s first and most mysterious cult movie!

Benjamin Christensen’s macabre masterpiece from 1922, Häxan (The Witch), is the first true ‘film maudit’ (literally a ‘cursed film’). This taboo-shattering work occupies an exclusive niche in the annals of horror cinema. Was Häxan the first and most perverse exploitation film, replete with Satanic debauchery, or the original classic of documentary cinema? Who was this mysterious man, Benjamin Christensen, and what really drove him to create this extraordinary epic?

Witchcraft Through the Ages is Volume 1 in the new Cinema Classics Collection from FAB Press, a series of budget-priced, highly collectable studies of historically important movies, genres and directors. This book is in stock and shipping now! It can be ordered exclusively here at FAB Press Online at a very special discount price. To order your copy, or to simply read more about it, click on the cover image on the left.

'... (makes for) a magnificent Christmas present'
- Total Film magazines (Denmark)
